(¬(A45 → A44) → ¬A46).natural: If it is not the case that whenever the agency conducts a scheduled inspection of the facility, then the agency conducts a routine inspection of the facility, then the agency does not conduct an emergency inspection of the facility.

(¬(¬(A45 → A44) → ¬A46) → A47).prover9_expression: (-(-(scheduled_inspection(agency, facility) -> routine_inspection(agency, facility)) -> -emergency_inspection(agency, facility)) -> shutdown_order(agency, facility))
(¬(¬(A45 → A44) → ¬A46) → A47).natural: Provided that it is not the case that if it is not the case that if the agency conducts a scheduled inspection of the facility, then the agency conducts a routine inspection of the facility, then the agency does not conduct an emergency inspection of the facility, then the agency issues a shutdown order for the facility.

(¬G → A8).natural: If the financial product does not have generic competition, then the financial product generates revenue.

(¬G → A9).natural: Under the condition that the financial product does not have generic competition, the financial product has market demand.

(¬G → ¬A8).natural: Should the financial product not have generic competition, then the financial product does not generate revenue.

A26.natural: The financial product monitors compliance at the facility.

A37.natural: The financial product has increased funding for the facility.

A38.natural: The agency has regulatory oversight over the facility.

A44.natural: The agency conducts a routine inspection of the facility.

A45.natural: The agency conducts a scheduled inspection of the facility.

G.natural: The financial product has generic competition.

¬A1.natural: The financial product does not have approval from the regulatory agency.

¬A10.natural: The financial product is not profitable.

¬A11.natural: The financial product is not sustainable.

¬A20.natural: The facility does not have a renewed license.

¬A47.natural: The agency does not issue a shutdown order for the facility.

¬A5.natural: The plant does not have contamination.
